title: Ticket #5749: Pegasus problems with DAG priorities
description:
Pegasus has run into problems with the current DAG node priority scheme (which I'd like to simplify anyhow).

This is from Mats:

I would like to see: 

   if defined(explicit node prio):
       // user provided a priority to use
       effective node prio = explicit node prio
   else:
       // no priority specified, use the default strategy
       effective node prio = max(parents' effective prios, DAG prio)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Stuff after this is from Kent:

I'd actually like to simplify things even more, maybe this: 

   if defined(explicit node prio):
       // user provided a priority to use
       effective node prio = explicit node prio
   else:
       // no priority specified, use the default strategy
       effective node prio = DAG prio

Or, maybe what I'd really like is this: 

   if defined(explicit node prio):
       // user provided a priority to use
       effective node prio = explicit node prio + DAG prio
   else:
       // no priority specified, use the default strategy
       effective node prio = DAG prio

That would get rid of the problem of increasing your DAG priority erasing priority differences between the nodes. I'm okay with either of the last two, though.

At any rate, I'd really like to get rid of the feature of a parent node's priority "trickling down" to its children -- I think that's complicated and hard to understand. Unless someone really needs that, I'd like to simplify things in that regard...

(Having the max() function in there causes problems if we ever implement having DAGMan respond to priority changes while it's running -- I'm sure there was a ticket about that somewhere, but I can't find it now.)

Anyhow, one issue with this is how much people are using DAG priorities right now, and whether this will goof things up for them.
remarks:

   if defined(explicit node prio):
       // user provided a priority to use
       effective node prio = explicit node prio + DAG prio
   else:
       // no priority specified, use the default strategy
       effective node prio = DAG prio

So I'm going to propose this on htcondor-users and see if anyone screams.
